children.text: The brickwork wall has been cut down in thickness, greatly reducing the strength of the wall.
The relevant Australian Standard, AS 4773 Masonry In Small Buildings, Section 9.3 Leaf Thickness states that
‘The thickness of the masonry veneer leaf shall be not less than 90 mm’.

This section of brickwork will need to be reconstructed to comply with this minimum standard. Alternatively, the builder should consult the engineer to confirm what rectifications if any will be necessary. The building surveyor should also be involved as it may need to be inspected. The owners should request a copy of the engineer’s comments/rectification design where applicable.
